availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John W. Leathers, Jr. (Kenton County state representative and farmer)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, farmer and state legislator. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth Leathers. Democratic member of the House of Representatives and Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Kenton County. Director of the Covington & Lexington Turnpike Company. Farmer in Kenton County in 1850. Owned one enslaved person in Kenton County in 1850. Farmer in Kenton County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Kenton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 150B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, District 1, p. 366.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, p. 106.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, District 1, p. 318B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Western Reserve, p. 364B.
Find A Grave, "John W. Leathers (1809-1873)," Memorial #95288046, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/95288046 (accessed September 18, 2019).
